importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the Dutch parliamentary election, which prompted the data protection watchdog to issue a warning about AI-generated voting advice.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which the Dutch privacy watchdog conducted AI chatbot testing and issued public warnings ahead of the upcoming election.

keyTakeAways: AI chatbots such as ChatGPT, Gemini, Mistral, and Grok provide a distorted and polarized view of political parties, often recommending fringe parties like the Party for Freedom (PVV) or Green Left-Labour Party.
In over half of the test cases, AI models identified the hard-right PVV or left-wing Green Left-Labour Party as the top choice for voters with hypothetical policy preferences.
Centrally positioned parties like Democrats 66 and People’s Party for Freedom and Democracy were recommended significantly less often.
Some parties such as Christian Democratic Appeal and Denk were almost never suggested by the AI models.
The Dutch Data Protection Authority warns that AI-generated voting advice is unverifiable, opaque, and potentially biased, threatening the integrity of democratic elections.
The authority urges voters not to use AI chatbots for voting decisions and calls on chatbot providers to prevent their systems from being used as political voting guides.

The upcoming election follows political instability caused by the Party for Freedom’s withdrawal from coalition talks over immigration policy, increasing public scrutiny of political trust and AI influence.

namedEntities.name: Dutch Data Protection Authority
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The national data protection regulatory body in the Netherlands.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The entity issued the official warning to the public about the risks of using AI to determine voting decisions, emphasizing transparency and democratic integrity.

namedEntities.name: ChatGPT
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A popular artificial intelligence chatbot developed by OpenAI.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It was one of four chatbots tested by the Dutch watchdog and was found to provide biased, polarized political recommendations.

namedEntities.name: Gemini
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An AI chatbot developed by Google.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It was included in the official tests and showed a strong tendency to recommend fringe parties, contributing to the watchdog’s warning.

namedEntities.name: Mistral
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An AI language model developed by Mistral AI.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It was tested by the Dutch authority and found to be biased in political recommendations, reinforcing concerns about AI influence on voting.

namedEntities.name: Grok
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An AI chatbot developed by xAI, Elon Musk’s company.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It was part of the four tested models and demonstrated a consistent pattern of recommending extreme political parties.

namedEntities.name: Party for Freedom (PVV)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A hard-right political party in the Netherlands, led by Geert Wilders.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is frequently recommended by AI chatbots, raising concerns about how AI may amplify extremist political influence.

namedEntities.name: Green Left-Labour Party
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A left-wing political party in the Netherlands.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is often identified as a top recommendation by AI chatbots, showing a polarization bias in political advice.

namedEntities.name: People’s Party for Freedom and Democracy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A right-leaning political party in the Netherlands.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It was significantly underrepresented in AI recommendations, indicating a bias toward more extreme political positions.

namedEntities.name: Democrats 66
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A centre-left political party in the Netherlands.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It was rarely recommended by AI models, suggesting that AI systems may misrepresent mainstream or moderate political options.

namedEntities.name: Christian Democratic Appeal
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A conservative Christian political party in the Netherlands.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It was almost never suggested by AI chatbots, indicating a lack of diversity in political representation through AI models.

namedEntities.name: Denk
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A left-leaning political party in the Netherlands.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It was almost never recommended by AI models, showing a systemic bias in political framing by AI systems.

namedEntities.name: Geert Wilders
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Leader of the Party for Freedom (PVV) in the Netherlands.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His anti-immigration stance and political influence have made the PVV a focal point in the election, and AI models frequently recommend his party.

namedEntities.name: October 29, 2025
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The date of the Dutch parliamentary election.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The timing of the AI warning is directly tied to this election, as the tests were conducted in anticipation of voting decisions.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Dutch Data Protection Authority has issued a public warning against using artificial intelligence chatbots—such as ChatGPT, Gemini, Mistral, and Grok—to determine voting preferences, stating that these models provide distorted, polarized, and biased political advice. Tests on 1,500 fictional voter profiles revealed that AI systems frequently recommended fringe parties like the hard-right Party for Freedom (PVV) or the left-wing Green Left-Labour Party, while significantly underrepresenting moderate parties such as Democrats 66 and the People’s Party for Freedom and Democracy. The watchdog emphasizes that AI systems are untransparent, unverifiable, and potentially manipulative, threatening the integrity of democratic elections. It urges voters to avoid using AI for voting decisions and calls on chatbot providers to prevent their platforms from being used as political voting guides. This comes as the PVV, led by Geert Wilders, is poised for another strong showing in the upcoming October 29 election, following political instability over immigration policy and the party’s repeated refusal to support coalition governments.
title: Dutch privacy watchdog warns voters against asking AI how to vote
